What is the general syntax for using the Verus RPC client?
The general syntax for using the Verus RPC client is `verus [options] [command]`. This allows you to issue a command to the coindaemon.

# Options available to the Verus RPC client.## Important General Information### Verus CLI version v1.2.2-4#### Usage:
`verus [options] [command]` Issue a command to the coindaemon
`verus [options] help` List commands
`verus [options] help <command>` Get help for a command### Verus `Wallet.dat`, Chaindata & `VRSC.conf` standard locationsLinux:		`~/.komodo/VRSC`
Mac OS: 	`~/Library/Application Support/Komodo/VRSC`
Windows 10: 	`%AppData%\Roaming\Komodo\VRSC\`# Options:`-?` This help message`-conf=<file>` Specify configuration file (default: komodo.conf)`-datadir=<dir>` Specify data directory`-testnet` Use the test network`-regtest` Enter regression test mode, which uses a special chain in which blocks
    can be solved instantly. This is intended for regression testing tools
    and app development.`-rpcconnect=<ip>` Send commands to node running on <ip> (default: 127.0.0.1)`-rpcport=<port>` Connect to JSON-RPC on <port> (default: 8232 or testnet: 18232)`-rpcwait` Wait for RPC server to start`-rpcuser=<user>` Username for JSON-RPC connections`-rpcpassword=<pw>` Password for JSON-RPC connections`-rpcclienttimeout=<n>` Timeout in seconds during HTTP requests, or 0 for no timeout.
    (default: 900)`-stdin` Read extra arguments from standard input, one per line until EOF/Ctrl-D
    (recommended for sensitive information such as passphrases)# Commands:## Addressindex### `getaddressbalance`
Returns the balance for an address(es) (requires addressindex to be enabled).
./raw_text_input_wiki/clifaq-02_verus_commands.md
How can I get help for a specific command using the Verus RPC client?
To get help for a specific command, you can use the `help` command followed by the specific command you need help with, like this: `verus [options] help <command>`.

# Options available to the Verus RPC client.## Important General Information### Verus CLI version v1.2.2-4#### Usage:
`verus [options] [command]` Issue a command to the coindaemon
`verus [options] help` List commands
`verus [options] help <command>` Get help for a command### Verus `Wallet.dat`, Chaindata & `VRSC.conf` standard locationsLinux:		`~/.komodo/VRSC`
Mac OS: 	`~/Library/Application Support/Komodo/VRSC`
Windows 10: 	`%AppData%\Roaming\Komodo\VRSC\`# Options:`-?` This help message`-conf=<file>` Specify configuration file (default: komodo.conf)`-datadir=<dir>` Specify data directory`-testnet` Use the test network`-regtest` Enter regression test mode, which uses a special chain in which blocks
    can be solved instantly. This is intended for regression testing tools
    and app development.`-rpcconnect=<ip>` Send commands to node running on <ip> (default: 127.0.0.1)`-rpcport=<port>` Connect to JSON-RPC on <port> (default: 8232 or testnet: 18232)`-rpcwait` Wait for RPC server to start`-rpcuser=<user>` Username for JSON-RPC connections`-rpcpassword=<pw>` Password for JSON-RPC connections`-rpcclienttimeout=<n>` Timeout in seconds during HTTP requests, or 0 for no timeout.
    (default: 900)`-stdin` Read extra arguments from standard input, one per line until EOF/Ctrl-D
    (recommended for sensitive information such as passphrases)# Commands:## Addressindex### `getaddressbalance`
Returns the balance for an address(es) (requires addressindex to be enabled).

Where are the standard locations for the Verus `wallet.dat`, chaindata, and `VRSC.conf` files on different operating systems?

The standard locations for the Verus `wallet.dat`, chaindata, and `VRSC.conf` files are:
* On Linux: `~/.komodo/VRSC`
* On Mac OS: `~/Library/Application Support/Komodo/VRSC`
* On Windows 10: `%AppData%\Roaming\Komodo\VRSC\`

What does the `-testnet` option do when using the Verus RPC client?
The `-testnet` option allows you to use the test network when running the Verus RPC client.

What is the purpose of the `-regtest` option when using the Verus RPC client?
The `-regtest` option enters regression test mode, which uses a special chain in which blocks can be solved instantly. This is intended for regression testing tools and app development.

How can I specify a configuration file when using the Verus RPC client?
You can specify a configuration file using the `-conf=<file>` option, where `<file>` is the path to your configuration file.

# Options available to the Verus RPC client.## Important General Information### Verus CLI version v1.2.2-4#### Usage:

What is the purpose of the `getaddressbalance` command in the Verus RPC client?
The `getaddressbalance` command returns the balance for an address(es), but it requires the addressindex to be enabled.

What is the addressindex, and why is it required for the `getaddressbalance` command?
The addressindex is a feature that needs to be enabled in order to use the `getaddressbalance` command, which returns the balance for an address(es).
